item.title: Server message when someone logs in!
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

horses2007:

i get an error when i do that :S

Don’t put the whole code in there, meaning don’t cut all that, go to initialize(); and paste it. Take loginMessage(); and declare it in initialize. Where everything else is declared.

item.title: Server message when someone logs in!
item.dc:creator: @horses2007 horses2007
item.description:
@horses2007 wrote:

okay, so i added a server message for when somebody logs in, and i got no errors compiling or running, but when someone logs in it doesn’t send the message any idea’s?
here is my code:

public void loginMessage() { for (int j = 0; j < Server.playerHandler.players.length; j++) { if (Server.playerHandler.players[j] != null) { Client c2 = (Client)Server.playerHandler.players[j]; switch (playerRights){ case 0: //Regular Player c2.sendMessage("[PLAYER] "+playerName+" has logged in."); break; case 1: //Donator c2.sendMessage("[DONATOR] "+playerName+" has logged in."); break; case 2: c2.sendMessage("@gre@[Moderator] "+playerName+" has logged in."); break; case 3: c2.sendMessage("[GLOBAL MODERATOR] "+playerName+" has logged in."); break; case 4: c2.sendMessage("@yel@[Adminstrator "+playerName+" has logged in."); break; case 5: c2.sendMessage("@red@[Owner] "+playerName+" has logged in."); break; } } } }

Read full topic
item.source: Server message when someone logs in!
